channel.title: How to remove an invisible folder & better solution to folder hiding
channel.description:
[center][b]How to remove an invisible folder & better solution to folder hiding [size=1pt]- by ZeroFreeze - www.moparisthebest.com/smf[/size][/b][/center]
Well, if you followed a tutorial that tells you how to make invisible folders (with alt + 0160 etc.) and at some point you decided you want to delete the folder, you probably found out that you couldn't.
Have no fear, I found a solution: 1. Open up your terminal. 2. cd to your desktop directory. 3. Type rd 0a001~ /s or on loonicks: rm -r 0a001~
There you go; it's gone now. :D
[hr]
P.S: There's a much, much better tool for doing such things:
You can easily hide, lock and/or encrypt your files (i.e. entertainment :rolleyes:) with a great program: File Lock. I just installed the pro version today and I must say, this program is [b]awesome[/b]. Buy the pro version or use a crk, it's worth it.
Download File Lock: - [url=http://dl.filekicker.com/nc/file/130083-0M78/folder-lock-gg.exe]Shareware version[/url] - [url=https://secure.bmtmicro.com/ECommerce-OffSite/01025/1025order.html?id=gg]Buy the pro version[/url] [size=1pt]- cräck: G0 t0 ur l0cal .wäréz st0re.[/size]
- ZeroFreeze

item.title: How to remove an invisible folder & better solution to folder hiding
item.dc:creator: @phonnygoblin phonnygoblin
item.description:
@phonnygoblin wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:1, topic:227095”][quote author=ken1337 link=topic=291342.msg2365628#msg2365628 date=1217932173]
just pus a password your windows login?
[/quote]
Learn to think thoroughly; you can’t even type properly: One word missing, ‘s’ instead of a ‘t’ used, although the ‘s’ is around 3cm away from the ‘t’ on a QWERTY keyboard. Strictly speaking, the first word (“just”) has to be capitalised and “windows” too.

Some families share PC’s; sometimes you don’t log out and go somewhere else; sometimes one of your parents or siblings wants to quickly use your computer for a few minutes (because it is on, for example). There are tons of reason why you’d use this - your post did not contribute anything to this topic, you were merely reflecting your idiocy and smart-ass-ness.

gg for writing one of the most idiotic posts I’ve ever seen.[/quote]

Capitalized* Fail for being a britjew

Read full topic
